member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket
member.summary: The WebSocket class allows applications to send and receive data after the WebSocket upgrade has completed.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the WebSocket connection and cancels any pending IO operations.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CloseAsync(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Closes the WebSocket connection as an asynchronous operation using the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.
member.param: Indicates the reason for closing the WebSocket connection.
Specifies a human readable explanation as to why the connection is closed.
The token that can be used to propagate notification that operations should be canceled.
member.returns: Returns . The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CloseOutputAsync(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates or completes the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.
member.param: Indicates the reason for closing the WebSocket connection.
Allows applications to specify a human readable explanation as to why the connection is closed.
The token that can be used to propagate notification that operations should be canceled.
member.returns: Returns . The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CloseStatus
member.summary: Indicates the reason why the remote endpoint initiated the close handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CloseStatusDescription
member.summary: Allows the remote endpoint to describe the reason why the connection was closed.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CreateClientBuffer(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create client buffers to use with this instance.
member.param: The size, in bytes, of the client receive buffer.
The size, in bytes, of the send buffer.
member.returns: Returns . An array with the client buffers.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CreateClientWebSocket(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Allows callers to create a client side WebSocket class which will use the WSPC for framing purposes.
member.param: The connection to be used for IO operations.
The subprotocol accepted by the client.
The size in bytes of the client WebSocket receive buffer.
The size in bytes of the client WebSocket send buffer.
Determines how regularly a frame is sent over the connection as a keep-alive. Applies only when the connection is idle.
Indicates whether a random key or a static key (just zeros) should be used for the WebSocket masking.
Will be used as the internal buffer in the WPC. The size has to be at least 2 * ReceiveBufferSize + SendBufferSize + 256 + 20 (16 on 32-bit).

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.CreateServerBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a WebSocket server buffer.
member.param: The size, in bytes, of the desired buffer.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.DefaultKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets the default WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval in milliseconds.
member.returns: Returns . The default WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval in milliseconds. The typical value for this interval is 30 seconds.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.Dispose
member.summary: Used to clean up unmanaged resources for ASP.NET and self-hosted implementations.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.IsApplicationTargeting45
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates if the WebSocket instance is targeting .NET Framework 4.5.
member.returns: Returns . true if the is targeting .NET Framework 4.5; otherwise false.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.IsStateTerminal(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates if the state of the WebSocket instance is closed or aborted.
member.param: The current state of the WebSocket.
member.returns: Returns . true if the is closed or aborted; otherwise false.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.ReceiveAsync(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Receives data from the connection asynchronously.
member.param: References the application buffer that is the storage location for the received data.
Propagates the notification that operations should be canceled.
member.returns: Returns . The task object representing the asynchronous operation. The property on the task object returns a array containing the received data.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.RegisterPrefixes
member.summary: This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Allows callers to register prefixes for WebSocket requests (ws and wss).

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.SendAsync(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketMessageType,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends data over the connection asynchronously.
member.param: The buffer to be sent over the connection.
Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message.
Indicates whether the data in "buffer" is the last part of a message.
The token that propagates the notification that operations should be canceled.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.State
member.summary: Returns the current state of the WebSocket connection.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.SubProtocol
member.summary: The subprotocol that was negotiated during the opening handshake.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.ThrowOnInvalidState(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState,System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState[])
member.summary: Verifies that the connection is in an expected state.
member.param: The current state of the WebSocket to be tested against the list of valid states.
List of valid connection states.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus
member.summary: Represents well known WebSocket close codes as defined in section 11.7 of the WebSocket protocol spec.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.Empty
member.summary: No error specified.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.EndpointUnavailable
member.summary: (1001) Indicates an endpoint is being removed. Either the server or client will become unavailable.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.InternalServerError
member.summary: The connection will be closed by the server because of an error on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.InvalidMessageType
member.summary: (1003) The client or server is terminating the connection because it cannot accept the data type it received.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.InvalidPayloadData
member.summary: (1007) The client or server is terminating the connection because it has received data inconsistent with the message type.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: (1010) The client is terminating the connection because it expected the server to negotiate an extension.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.MessageTooBig
member.summary: (1004) Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.NormalClosure
member.summary: (1000) The connection has closed after the request was fulfilled.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.PolicyViolation
member.summary: (1008) The connection will be closed because an endpoint has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: (1002) The client or server is terminating the connection because of a protocol error.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext
member.summary: Used for accessing the information in the WebSocket handshake.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.CookieCollection
member.summary: The cookies that were passed to the server during the opening handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.Headers
member.summary: The HTTP headers that were sent to the server during the opening handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.IsAuthenticated
member.summary: Whether the WebSocket client is authenticated.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.IsLocal
member.summary: Whether the WebSocket client connected from the local machine.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.IsSecureConnection
member.summary: Whether the WebSocket connection is secured using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.Origin
member.summary: The value of the Origin HTTP header included in the opening handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.RequestUri
member.summary: The URI requested by the WebSocket client.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.SecWebSocketKey
member.summary: The value of the SecWebSocketKey HTTP header included in the opening handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.SecWebSocketProtocols
member.summary: The value of the SecWebSocketKey HTTP header included in the opening handshake.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.SecWebSocketVersion
member.summary: The list of subprotocols requested by the WebSocket client.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.User
member.summary: An object used to obtain identity, authentication information, and security roles for the WebSocket client.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketContext.WebSocket
member.summary: The WebSocket instance used to interact (send/receive/close/etc) with the WebSocket connection.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError
member.summary: Contains the list of possible WebSocket errors.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.ConnectionClosedPrematurely
member.summary: Indicates that the connection was terminated unexpectedly.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.Faulted
member.summary: Indicates a general error.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.HeaderError
member.summary: Indicates an error occurred when parsing the HTTP headers during the opening handshake.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.InvalidMessageType
member.summary: Indicates that a WebSocket frame with an unknown opcode was received.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.InvalidState
member.summary: Indicates the WebSocket is an invalid state for the given operation (such as being closed or aborted).

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.NativeError
member.summary: Indicates that an unknown native error occurred.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.NotAWebSocket
member.summary: Indicates that the incoming request was not a valid websocket request.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.Success
member.summary: Indicates that there was no native error information for the exception.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.UnsupportedProtocol
member.summary: Indicates that the client requested an unsupported WebSocket subprotocol.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketError.UnsupportedVersion
member.summary: Indicates that the client requested an unsupported version of the WebSocket protocol.

member.summary: The message is in binary format.

member.summary: A receive has completed because a close message was received.

member.summary: The message is clear text.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState
member.summary: Defines the different states a WebSockets instance can be in.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.Aborted
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.Closed
member.summary: Indicates the WebSocket close handshake completed gracefully.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.CloseReceived
member.summary: A close message was received from the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.CloseSent
member.summary: A close message was sent to the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.Connecting
member.summary: The connection is negotiating the handshake with the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.None
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState.Open
member.summary: The initial state after the HTTP handshake has been completed.
